command: [withheld] PowerShell spawning mshta.exe to load script content leading to a secondary process launch, indicative of proxy execution (details redacted).
explanation: mshta.exe (a Microsoft-signed script host) can proxy execution of script content that then launches additional binaries, abusing trust in the signed utility.
rationale_steps: Identify powershell.exe as parent of mshta.exe, which is atypical for normal workflows.
mshta.exe command line points to script content (local/embedded/remote) with unusual parameters.
Unexpected child process (e.g., cmd.exe or powershell.exe) spawns from mshta.exe.
Network egress or remote path usage correlates with the mshta session.
No corresponding user-driven HTA UI interaction observed (headless behavior).
